page.title: 13FARMING AROUND FLITWICK.1.
page.content: OF THE 2,965 ACRES APPROXIMATELY 1,450 ARE ARABLE LAND,200 PERMANENT GRASS AND 350 WOOD.THE SOIL IS PRINCIPALLY SAND. TO THE NORTH WEST IS A LARGE, PRIVATELY OWNED ESTATE, SOME 500 ACRES OF WHICH LIE WITHIN OUR BOUNDARIES AND ARE USED FOR MIXED FARMING, HAVING A DAIRY HERD OF 300 FRIESIAN CATTLE, THE REMAINDER BEING SET TO WHEAT AND BARLEY WITH SOME SUGAR BEET AND STOCK_FEED BEANS. THE ESTATE HAS ITS OWN RESERVOIR AND CAN IRRIGATE ITS ACREAGE. TO THE SOUTH IS A 30 ACRE SHEEP FARM. MOST OF THE REMAINDER IS OWNED BY THE COUNTY COUNCIL AND LEASED TO SIX TENANT FARMERS. THE MAIN CROPS ARE WHEAT AND BARLEY, WHICHARE HARVESTED BY CONTRACTORS. 5% OF THE LAND IS SET TO VEGETABLES, WHICH SUPPLY TWO FARM SHOPS.'
